explanation: [0-0] On a patch of land by the road, there are tools for smelting metal. A person wearing a red apron is standing on the left, and a person wearing gray pants and black cloth shoes is stepping on a large stone with a gap in it. To the left of the stone is a black bucket containing a silver liquid. In front of the camera, there are two iron plates in a basin filled with water.

[0-5] The man stepping on the stone clamps the black bucket with pliers in his right hand and pours the liquid in the bucket into the gap in the stone. It can be seen that the liquid in the bucket is molten metal. Then, the gap in the stone is filled with molten metal. The man puts down the bucket, the excess molten metal overflows. The man stepping on the stone hands the pliers to the person opposite him, and with his right hand, he takes an iron plate from the basin on the right and inserts it into the molten metal in the stone.

[5-11] Then the man uses the iron plate to scrape the excess molten metal into the bucket on the ground. After the man cleans up the molten metal on the stone gap, the person wearing the red apron takes the bucket to the right with pliers. Then the man puts the iron plate back into the water to cool it down, and then inserts the iron plate into the molten metal to make the metal fit the stone. After adjusting it, the man puts the iron plate back into the water.
